solution_line_template: Roberto has received 2 raises. On his first raise he received a 40% bump, therefore his new salary was ${starting_salary} * {first_raise_percent}% = $<<{starting_salary}*{first_raise_percent}*{percent_factor}={after_first_raise_salary}>>{after_first_raise_salary}

On his second raise, Roberto received a 20% bump, therefore his current salary is ${after_first_raise_salary} * {second_raise_percent}% = $<<{after_first_raise_salary}*{second_raise_percent}*{percent_factor}={current_salary}>>{current_salary}
